I installed it for the achievements. I sure as shit ain't gonna waste 40 dollars on a glorified "mission pack" with the same rinse and repeat formula and boring, stale structure. So far, the missions boil down to "head to the objective, defend the objective , escort the objective" 
Have you played Junkenstein's Revenge or literally any other of the past events Blizzard kept regurgitating over the years? 
If yes, you have played this as well.
No need to wait for a sale, this is beyond worthless.

I installed this game with the intention of playing the story missions that were advertised on the front page of steam only to realise that they're a $15 add on. this was my first ever playing overwatch and while I do think it does offer fun gameplay, its not something I could play on a regular basis. the one thing I will credit blizzard for is not being as obnoxious as ubisoft and EA while playing their product. a smooth one time linkage between your steam and battle net account is all you need, no requirement for opening a second launcher every time you play the game.

“这里是无节操，无廉耻，无专业的三无网络游戏秀，我是风一样的坑爹哥”那年一六年，小学四五年级 那会儿最爱看坑爹哥直播回顾玩的守望先锋，第一次了解到原来还有这样的游戏。即使我没有和你们一样和好兄弟好朋友一起开黑的游戏时光，可是我们共同拥有的属于守望先锋那段开心快乐的回忆。在去年也是补上了末班车票，游戏已经不再是那个游戏，那份回忆终将只是回忆
